data.title: Fixed #12906 : Can't add custom member to cocos2d::Scene subclass.
data.body:
#12906

The reason is when compile CCScene.cpp, the CC_ENABLE_BULLIET_INTERATION=1 effect the CCScene.h, but when compile the custom scene derived from scene in new game project, the CC_ENABLE_BULLIET_INTERATION not defined. This cause the Scene class layout in cocos2dlib and in derived class is different.

This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.

data.title: Add addChild(child, zOrder, name) in the web engine
Physics debugDraw does not match with nodes when Scene is transformed
data.body:
If a transformation is applied to the Scene, such as MoveBy/To, ScaleBy/To, or RotateBy/To,  the debugDraw layer no longer matches up with the visual nodes.

This is easiest to see by adding a runAction to PhysicsTests.cpp of cpp-tests:

> void PhysicsDemo::toggleDebug()
> {
>    runAction( RotateBy::create( 2.0, 360 ));
>    ....

You can see that the debug frames spin as expected with the non-physics elements on the scene, whereas the actual nodes (such as the sprites of grossini in Pyramid Stack test) spin as a group the wrong direction, as well as individually spinning, which they shouldn't.

data.title: Android 5.1.1 (Nexus) Audio Playback Causes Frame Skipping
data.body:
Hello

WAV. files played by SimpleAudioEngine's playEffect() method is causing frame skipping from time to time on Android 5.1.1 on different Nexus devices (tested on Nexus 5 and 6). Sounds are also not played properly when they are played rapidly which works without any problems on any other device.

I am receiving strange audio logs each time an effect is played:

D/audio_hw_primary(  355): out_set_parameters: enter: usecase(1: low-latency-playback) kvpairs: routing=2
D/audio_hw_primary(  355): out_set_parameters: enter: usecase(3: compress-offload-playback) kvpairs: routing=0
D/audio_hw_primary(  355): out_set_parameters: enter: usecase(3: compress-offload-playback) kvpairs: closing=true
D/audio_hw_primary(  355): out_set_parameters: enter: usecase(3: compress-offload-playback) kvpairs: exiting=1
D/offload_visualizer(  355): thread exit
D/audio_hw_primary(  355): disable_audio_route: reset and update mixer path: compress-offload-playback speaker
E/audio_hw_primary(  355): offload_thread_loop: Compress handle is NULL
W/AudioFlinger(  355): moveEffectChain_l() effect chain for session 0 not on source thread 0xb59c4000
D/audio_hw_primary(  355): adev_set_parameters: enter: rotation=90
D/mot_vr_audio_hw(  355): adev_set_parameters: rotation=90
D/audio_hw_primary(  355): out_set_parameters: enter: usecase(1: low-latency-playback) kvpairs: routing=2

data.title: Is v3.7 using a difference size system?
data.body: Hello, I am trying to migrate my project from 3.6 to 3.7 and notice that all my Labels are huge! It turns out that v3.7 has changed the size system from pixels to a "universal dimension"? With the following codes: ``` Size visibleSize = Director::getInstance()->getVisibleSize(); cout << visibleSize.width << endl; cout << visibleSize.height << endl; ``` It used to print out the pixel dimension of the display, so 750 and 1334 for iphone 6. But it's now giving me 179.91,320 for iphone 6 and 180,320 for iphone 6+. Here is a screenshot running on iphone 6. I couldn't find any reference to this in the change logs. Could anyone clear up the confusion? Thanks!

data.body:
The old cocos print functions don't display table and userdata address.
That will not distinguish different tables and different userdatas. 

So I ported the lua core print function hope this may help.

data.title: [ci skip] Update release docs for v3.7
Update html5 engine ref
Fix ClippingRectangleNode scissor positioning
data.body:
Currently, `onBeforeVisitScissor` function scales BOTH the position and
size by the nodes world scale.  The position, however, is already in
world coordinates since it is passed through `convertToWorldSpace`. This
change ensures that a rectangle in the local space of the node which
is passed into `setClippingRegion` is correctly converted to GL coords
before it is passed to `glScissor`.
